title: HIFI-KPI: A Dataset for Hierarchical KPI Extraction from Earnings Filings
author: Rasmus Aavang (Aalborg University), Giovanni Rizzi (ALIPES ApS), Rasmus Bøggild (ALIPES ApS), Alexandre Iolov (ALIPES ApS), Mike Zhang (Aalborg University), Johannes Bjerva (Aalborg University), ...
relevance_why: The dataset focuses on extracting key financial performance indicators from earnings filings, which can enhance audio-related financial analysis and investment strategies in the audio domain.
background: Extracting hierarchical key performance indicators (KPIs) from unstructured financial texts like earnings filings to assess corporate financial health.
contribution: HIFI-KPI introduces a structured dataset and taxonomy-based extraction approach for financial KPIs to facilitate better financial analysis tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing datasets often lack fine-grained labeling and structured extraction methods for financial texts.
technical_comparison.novelty: This research improves by providing a large-scale, hierarchical dataset that merges iXBRL tags with textual data, enabling various downstream NLP tasks.

key_innovation: The use of taxonomy-based grouping to streamline the extraction process and enhance the interpretability of financial data.
real_world_impact: The dataset and methodologies can revolutionize how financial data is parsed and analyzed, supporting investors in making informed decisions based on quantitative financial health indicators.
limitations: Variance in annotation quality due to differences in companies’ reporting practices may impact dataset reliability.

new_terms.iXBRL: **Inline eXtensible Business Reporting Language** is a format for digital financial reporting that allows for easier analysis of financial documents.
new_terms.KPI: **Key Performance Indicator** refers to measurable values that demonstrate how effectively a company is achieving its key business objectives.

open_sourcing: Code and data are available at https://github.com/aaunlp/HiFi-KPI
